_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The question and answer sequence about g: But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would pleasure and pain arise in oneself?
The understanding reached by the mendica: There is no return to any state of existence.
